io.confluent.ksql.util

Class LimitedProxyBuilder<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.confluent.ksql.util.LimitedProxyBuilder<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the interface type that is to be proxied.

    public final class LimitedProxyBuilder<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Creates a proxy around an instance of a class, only allowing white listed function calls.

    None white listed function calls result in an UnsupportedOperationException.

    Proxies are used to minimise the impact of new methods being added to interfaces from products outside the control of KSQL, e.g. avoiding compilation errors if a new method is added to an interface.

      • swallow

        public LimitedProxyBuilder<T> swallow(java.lang.String methodName,
                                      io.confluent.ksql.util.LimitedProxyBuilder.MethodParams methodParams)
        Add method(s) whose invocation should be swallowed, i.e. result in a no-op.

        Method must have a void return type.

        Parameters:
        methodName - the name of the method.
        methodParams - the type of the method.
        Returns:
        the builder.

      • forward

        public LimitedProxyBuilder<T> forward(java.lang.String methodName,
                                      io.confluent.ksql.util.LimitedProxyBuilder.MethodParams methodParams,
                                      java.lang.Object delegate)
        Add method(s) whose invocations should be forwarded to a delegate.

        If the delegate implements T, then invocations will be forwarded to the same method on the delegate.

        If the delegate does not implement T, then invocations will be forwarded to a method with the same name, return type and parameter types on the delegate.

        Parameters:
        methodName - the name of the method.
        methodParams - the type of the method.
        delegate - the delegate to forward to.
        Returns:
        the builder

      • anyParams

        public static io.confluent.ksql.util.LimitedProxyBuilder.MethodParams anyParams()
        A special marker MethodParams instance, that matches methods with any params.

        i.e. this instance can be used to include all flavours of a method.

        Returns:
        the special instance.
